intro: Calandrinia cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that are often reddish in color, and it produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, and the plant is well adapted to arid environments. Calandrinia cylindrica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
